Reviews.Title: Please DO NOT BUY this camera
Reviews.Author: W. Design
Reviews.Content: First I have to say I am AMAZED at how this camera has 4 stars. It is the only reason I felt compelled to write a review. I have purchased 9 different cameras in the last 2 months. The only way this camera has such a high rating is that they paid a bunch of their employees or friends to give this camera 4 and 5 stars. This camera was by far the worst out of the 9 cameras I tried. I didn't get a lemon, read the reviews carefully. Skip all of the positive reviews. You can throw a dart against any results for outdoor ip camera on Amazon and you will be doing better than if you pick this camera. This camera is below sub par. The night vision is unusable. The halo created around the image is horrible!!! The image is just barely visible. The camera resets frequently. I thought it was because the camera was on wifi. I purchased the top of the line repeater. I have a $180 router. It still dropped the connection at least once a day. When it resets it goes back to a position that you can not control. I tried direct connecting the camera and guess what??? Yes the camera still dropped connection (even though every other camera has worked flawlessly when direct connected). There are much better options, a well trained pigeon would be a better option. I just purchased the Loftek Sentinel Wireless Pan/tilt 3xzoom Waterproof Outdoor&indoor; Dome Camera and it is a much better camera for $30 less. It does everything this camera does without the night vision. If you have night lights you don't need the night vision. If night vision is such a big option with pan and tilt buy the Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) - Black NEWEST MODEL and put it in a spot where it wont get wet or build a housing for it. The screws in this camera are horrible, they are small like the ones you find in sunglasses and you will strip them or their inserts when you try and remove the dome to focus this camera. The camera comes completely out of focus. There is no firmare upgrades. The technical support and forum answers on their website are laughable. Loftek Nexus 543 Outdoor Wireless/wired Waterproof Ip Camera is a better camera even though it is a fixed camera and much cheaper but the winner in my opinion is Shark $400 or Trivision (a Shark clone) for about $100 less. Whatever you do, do not buy this camera. You will decide that this is a paper weight that you should have returned weeks ago instead of trying to get it to work. You will check your return period. It will have expired. You will be angry and sad.

Reviews.Title: Agasio A622W
Reviews.Author: Mr TV
Reviews.Content: The camera itself isn't bad during daylight hours.The functioning / software of the camera leaves a lot to be desired.The box the camera came in is labeled PTZ. It's only PT!The infra red at night is terrible. You have a circular haze all around the picture and hardly any picture.I would not recommend this camera!!!!I had to write a bad review to get any kind of tech support.I have the Foscam FI8910W for my interior and it is great. I'll probably buy another one.How can the same company screw this up is beyond me.

Reviews.Title: IR lighting reflections.
Reviews.Author: The D-Man
Reviews.Content: This product is decent, and passable so far for the price.  I can't really understand why they're NOT using 802.11n wireless, not only for the range but the speed.  The second issue is that the IR emitters at night actually reflect back into the dome glass and make the view a rather fuzzy, and useless rendition of whatever the camera is pointing at.Setup was actually very easy, but as a network engineer you'd expect that.  I could see an average person struggling with the setup.  We have 6 other IP cameras by various vendors from Trendnet to Zmodo.  This is the first supposed all weather camera we've mounted in the "elements" of Minnesota.Any kind of optical zoom would have been nice, but it doesn't have it, and not even the digital zoom works in the Agasio Internet explorer control page, nor from our tablets using Foscam settings.The low light sensitivity is actually pretty nice.  The camera quality is average at best, and oddly, the whole glass dome turns when using 360 pan.  I can't see that holding up in the winter, and it's mind boggling why you'd have a weather enclosed dome camera, but choose to turn the glass dome instead of the camera mounting inside the dome.  Weird.Three stars is generous, and largely just due to price.  BTW - its actually a pretty big unit, so be prepared for that.

Reviews.Title: Real world results for this camera
Reviews.Author: T. Currie
Reviews.Content: This product works well, if you do these things....1. Use the wired connection to configure it if you intend to use it via wireless. Very simple to configure if you have basic skills adding things to your Wireless Network, or can read a manual and guess.2. The built-in web admin page is nearly useless , download Mozilla to configure this cam, skip Internet Explorer, it isn't worth the hassle to bypass the IE security since their Active-x object is unsigned.3. If you have a Synology, you need to choose the Foscam 8910W camera (works great), Agasio is NOT a Mfr. in their list. works great with Surveillance Station/DS Cam4. If you use Android, you will need to get "IP Camviewer Basic" (unless you have Synology), free from the store.5. If you use Apple devices, you will want "Livecams Pro" from the store (unless you have Synology), this is $1.99 (this product actually does multi-cam view and will take you to cameras all over the globe, bonus!)The above was discovered by fiddling and calling support, nothing in the manual will help you with this important info... which makes no sense at all.  It comes with software that finds the camera on your network, and launches you to the awful admin page.The night vision inside was way cool, outside you do have the halo effect mentioned in other reviews, unless the IR can bounce off of something like your house. This produces an outstanding image at night. Out in the open yard, halo, but you still get great picture in the center and you can see clearly out to 35 feet or so. If you could bounce the IR, it might do better at greater distance (I can't test that). For this price, you have no right to expect the image in daylight to be better than it is, excellent price/performance in my opinion. The P/T works properly, but the device randomly resets itself to "home posistion" overnight, no way to change home in the interface and telling it not to in the interface does not stop it. The housing is metal, and seems to be very sturdy. This device uses a wall wart power supply and has an ethernet jack on the power cord that is not small, which presents a problem in the average exterior plug box. I had to get a double gang all weather box and extension cord, the power cord isn't very long, you might want to buy these with the camera.Overall, for the price, the housing is great, the day and night images are great, the tech support was good, called back with correct answers (my request) within an hour I think.  The manual, included software, and the web interface are terrible, the halo thing is dumb but does not bother me.  This cam was easy for me to configure, but it wasn't my first rodeo.  I have a Panasonic BL-C230 PTZ, the 2 products are not equal (nor are the prices or the overall spit and polish).  I have yet to configure the triggers/alarms, but will update this if they do not work.If you think all those reviews with 5 stars are not from the company trying to boost the ratings, you might be too easily impressed by reviews. I would just say that I have no idea what the support guys name was, and cannot imagine why I would care, he got me answers though. I am a technology geek and I don't like crappy electronics.  This is not a "5 Star" product, but neither does it have a "5 Star" price and I will be keeping it... If you need a hammer, don't go buy a screwdriver.

Reviews.Title: Very good ip camera
Reviews.Author: Bob
Reviews.Content: This is my third ip/wifi cam, the other two being an Astak Mole, and Sharx, and now this Agasio. It works well, no issues out of the box, setup was just like any other ip cam: get it set up on your network, access it's setup page via a browser on your local lan, and voila. Everything as expected, but the users manual is electronic on the CD provided in the box. I bought this as an outdoor, wifi, nightvision ip cam with pan and tilt. It is working great inside, I have not yet set it up outside to determine how reliable and waterproof it is. I use the Blue Iris software to monitor all my ip cams in one window, set up alerts, and provide web acess to all the feeds. Blue Iris did not have a setting for the A622W, but selecting the A601W worked, just FYI. It seems rugged and well built.The only thing I do not like is the all in one cable that is hard wired to the camera. The reset button, power, and wired netwok all use a single cable that has 3 connectors on one end that is hard wired to the internals of the camera. I will use this over wifi, so I don't need the bulk of the thick cable and wired LAN connector, but it cannot be removed and makes mouting it to the wall difficult as the tangle of cable/connectors doesn't quite fit in the small recess on the mounting plate.

Reviews.Title: Worked for 10 minutes, then dead, dead, dead...
Reviews.Author: Phil Ciccone
Reviews.Content: As others have posted, similar experiences here. The camera will work for about 10 minutes then completely go offline. If you power cycle it, you get 10 more minutes before failing. The IR at night is completely useless with the reflection back from the dome. I suppose a properly designed outdoor camera that advertises use for nighttime should have the IR lights OUTSIDE the dome!! It appears that Agasio is really Foscam, or has purchased Foscam's software as the interface is *nearly* the same. UPDATE: Second camera arrived. Same problems - just now this one stays up a few hours instead of a few minutes! Serious WiFi firmware flaws I assume. Now I have to climb this tree again and take it down!!

Reviews.Title: No Support
Reviews.Author: jeff
Reviews.Content: I guess I should have known when I went to the website and clicked on Support it said "Coming soon" I was getting an inferior brand and product. Stay away.

Reviews.Title: Agasio A622W
Reviews.Author: Amazon Fan
Reviews.Content: This is my 4th camera and like the other 3 Agasio cameras, this camera has a lot of promise.  It looks and feels well made.  The picture both in daylight and a night is satisfactory for all my needs.  On the needs improvement side of the equation, the WebUI is buggy and inconsistent like the other Agasio cameras I have bought.  Two of the cameras had to be returned for replacements because of failing or missing functionality.  The A622W works but it is missing the manufactures DDNS (gipcam).  Instead, the setting is populated with Chinese DDNS sites that don't seem to work from the U.S.  Also, even though the A622W has LEDs for night vision, there is no way to turn them On/Off like on the other Agasio cameras (even though the setting for IR on the A612 I have returns an "Error Unsupport" message).  When I contacted support (through email, since I can't get them to answer my phone calls) they gave me a short response with a link to the manual for the product which has NO mention of the LEDs.  The best I can say about the manual is that it is obviously a work in progress.  Most of the figures shown in the manual do not match any of the Agasio cameras I have.  When I've contacted support about other errors in the software, the standard response is to update the WebUI.  However, the latest version of the WebUI is not on the website for many of the products.  You can only tell what version of the WebUI is on the website by downloading and installing it on the camera since they don't bother to publish it on the website.  Twice I have put older versions of the WebUI on cameras that shipped with newer versions of this software.  Neither time did it resolve the issues I was having.UPDATE:  4 out of 5 of the Agasio Cameras that I bought have now failed and had to be returned for replacement (Two of these cameras were replacements for the Agasio cameras I originally bought that failed...now the replacements have failed in a matter of weeks.  Agasio charges the customer shipping (both directions) for a camera that fails outside of 14 days.  Also, you have to pay for shipping a DOA unit directly back to Agasio.  They claim they will reimburse shipping charges for DOA units but they have not.  My recommendation is to avoid Agasio cameras because the quality is bad, really bad.  I've wasted so much time and money putting these cameras up, taking then down, boxing up and continually shipping these cameras back to Agasio (and as I said previously, at my expense!)

Reviews.Title: Poor night performance
Reviews.Author: Buddy
Reviews.Content: This was purchased mainly for night time use.  When the ir lights come on it makes a white halo from the reflection on the glass.  This dramatically decreases the field of view.  This is very disappointing.

Reviews.Title: Resets and moves by itself a lot. Image at night not good. LEDs stopped working
Reviews.Author: Gamer "Gamer"
Reviews.Content: The images in the daytime are okay, but at night they are not clear. It is good enough to know if you had someone in your driveway, but not good enough for the police to identify them (had a person break into the car that is within 5 feet of the camera. Was at 11:00 PM. We could see the guy walk up to the car, break in, even looked at the camera a few times, but the picture was not good enough for the police to use to identify him).  The camera also resets itself several times per day and then pans itself away from where you set it (like into a wall). The interface on the camera only works "ok" with Internet Explorer, but even then many functions don't work. It tries to install and ActiveX component, and even if you allow it it will not work.  It is probably better to spend more on a reliable camera than this unless you only need very limited viewing or have good lighting at night. Also note that this camera does not have focus or zoom!

Reviews.Title: good camera, bad manual/software
Reviews.Author: diydan
Reviews.Content: I've had the camera up and running for a couple of weeks now and I am very happy with it.  The picture is good, the pan and tilt work fine and the night vision is excellent.  There was some reflection of the IR LEDs off of the plastic dome but it was negligible in my opinion.  The housing is pretty solid and looks nice, almost like an outside light. Physically and mechanically, this is a great camera for the price.  I would give it 5 stars but for the manual and the software interface which are both abysmal.  The manual I rec'd was not for the camera I bought.  Set up was similar but not the same.  I'm fairly savvy with networking and routers so I was able to get it running after about 30 minutes but someone who was not computer-minded would likely have a very difficult time trying to figure out what's going on.  The interface depicted in the manual and the one that comes with the camera are also completely different and many of the buttons in the software do not work (IR LEDs, etc).  Worse is that, things are described in the manual that you really have to work at to figure out in the interface.  That being said, it is possible to figure it out and now that it's up and running, I've had no problems with it, other than one reboot.  I guess I'd say that if you're tech-savvy and you don't mind the steep learning curve, this is a very good camera for the price.UPDATE:  Well, after using this for the better part of a year, I have to downgrade my recommendation.  While the CCD hardware is still in good shape (bright, well-detailed picture) the wireless hardware and perhaps the power systems have degraded significantly.  Shortly after I posted my initial recommendation, I started having issues with reboots.  For no apparent reason, the camera would shut down and restart.  The restart was immediate so it was kind of like a power cycle but I have no idea as to why this would happen.  It could happen at any time of the day or night and there was nothing obvious to blame it on.  Since it did reboot immediately, it was more of an annoyance than anything else and it seems to have leveled off to happening once or twice a month.  The more important issue is the wireless.  About 2 months after I purchased it, I noticed I wasn't getting a picture.  At first I thought it was another reboot, but after looking at the camera, I could see it was working, I just wasn't getting a signal.  I tried connecting it directly to my ethernet and then I got a picture.  So I fiddled with the antennae, checked all of the connections and rebooted.  Still nothing.  Finally, I went into the software and re-entered all of the info for my local net and rebooted again - it worked!  Since then, this has happened 3 times and each time, the only fix I've found is to re-enter the network data.  Again, this is more of an annoyance than anything else (now that I know what to do) but, with the other issue, it's resulted in a lowering of my recommendation.  Hopefully, with the newer cameras, these issues will be fixed, but until then, I'd have to say - stay away from this model

Reviews.Title: The Camera sends an email on IP change, very easy to setup.
Reviews.Author: Frank J Liptak
Reviews.Content: Works well in my application which is monitoring a retreat building 800 miles away which has a network connection of course.I do not use the Wifi connection, it is hard wired to a router.The Camera sends an email on IP change and works well since it is not a fixed IP and I do not have a DDNS service setup.

Reviews.Title: Hard to set up and motion sensor does not work
Reviews.Author: Rockntractor
Reviews.Content: After three weeks of fooling with it we finally got it online but motion sensor does not work. It will send you literaly 100's of false alarm pictures in a day but will not trigger when you jump up and down in front of it.Spent so much time setting up that we are past return time.Very poor choice and will not buy any more Agasio products

Reviews.Title: Poor man's security camera
Reviews.Author: Not My Real Name
Reviews.Content: Low resolution. Can't be controlled by some 3rd party foscam-compatible apps. Reflection from glass dome. Servos are shaky. Ir is low power.Update: image is shaky/corrupted - am sending back for a replacement. IR halo is really problematic.

Reviews.Title: Good camera, if only it would keep working
Reviews.Author: Gary
Reviews.Content: I really wanted to give this camera a good review, as it worked great when it worked. The glare from the IR LEDs was not too bad...just a faint halo around the edges, and the daylight color was very true to life. But after a couple of days, it kept dropping off my wireless network. The only way to get it back was to disconnect the power, then reconnect it. I replied to the email from Foscam about my purchase, and told them about this. They told me to try changing channels and move the camera closer to the router. This helped for about a day and a half. Then it dropped off the network again. So I ran a temporary network cable out to the camera. The next morning, it was off the network again. I checked the list of attached devices in my router software, and the camera was listed as connected, but It would not show up in the camera software. Also, when I clicked on the "Audio" icon, all I would get was a loud buzz. I returned the camera to Amazon for a refund and ordered a new one. The second one worked great the first day. But the next day, it was stuck in the IR mode, with a black & white picture that would constantly flash, as it was getting too much light for IR mode. I tried resetting the camera, which erased all my wireless network programming, and changed everything back to factory default, but it was still stuck in IR mode. Also, I could get no audio out of this one. I may just have gotten a couple of lemons, but I didn't want to chance trying another one, so I just returned the second one for a refund, then I ordered a "Loftek Sentinel D3 4-9mm 3x Optical Zoom Lens Outdoor Waterproof Wireless Pan/tilt Night Vision Dome Camera with Ir-cut Off Filter, Auto-iris". This camera looks almost identical to the Agasio, but it has a 3x optical zoom lens, and it is slightly larger. Hopefully, this one will preform better.

Reviews.Title: Excellent Camera and a great price!
Reviews.Author: Techno Geek Guru "Dave"
Reviews.Content: I've owned this camera for 5 months now. Over the past 10 years I've owned more than a dozen network cameras. Today I have eight running at home and my parents place. I have had some bad cameras in the past and some great ones! So far this camera has worked extremely well.Installation:I mounted the camera on the corner of my house in under 30 minutes, ran the Ethernet cable with external power over Ethernet adaptors and had it up and running in under an hour. Although this unit is wifi capable I always run cameras on Ethernet as its much more reliable. In addition, you need to power the unit so why not kill two tasks as the same time and run power over the Ethernet.About the Camera (Physical):  The camera itself is built from solid material. The dome will swivel around to the required spot and by undoing the 3 nuts at the top it will allow you to remove dome enough allowing you to get your drill into place to screw & mount the arm against a wall.  Once installed, the dome can be then screwed back into the elbow at the top. The camera and IR inside the dome are mounted very flush against the glass so there is no reflection of the IR off the glass back into the camera. Many other cameras have this problem! The camera makes very little noise when it's being moved. The IR sensors create a very small red glow in the dark but are very hard to notice. The camera has functioned perfectly since day one. I'm not sure what the specs say but the camera has functioned without a problem down to -20F. The motors that move the camera and the electronics have functioned flawlessly. I have not used or tested the wireless portion of the camera and would suggest which ever camera you purchase to do whatever you can to use a network cable and power over Ethernet if need be.Camera Software:The software is probably the biggest downfall of the camera. When you login it gives you 4 different options to use (IE mode, push or VLC modes for Safari/Firefox/Crome and snap mode for cell phone). In some ways this is good as you can select what kind of view/software you would like to use and you're not using some software that kind of functions as it was designed for another browser. Although it works with all browsers it has a few more functions with IE and a slightly better outlay. The overall software could be given a little sharper look. The buttons have no names but are easy to figure out with 5 minutes of using the camera. As everyone has their own preferences it takes only a few minutes to go through all the available menus to set your preferences. One downfall is the OSD (On Screen Display) of the time and date. You can set this to any color which is fine but as the camera moves the background color changes making the OSD unreadable a lot of the time. They need to enable a black box to appear around the OSD so it's always viewable. The software has many options which really help you overcome any unique problems that come up like flipping the camera, DSL settings, screen rate, dial up, FTP, PR speeds and the list goes on. The camera responds very quickly with all commands. I have accessed the camera from home and away on my laptop, mobile phone and IPAD in the US and overseas and each time the camera worked perfectly. I have some 3rd part software on my IPHONE and IPAD that access all my cameras and the camera is supported by this software. I have never had to reset or reboot the camera to fix any issues. The good thing about any of the minor issues I mentioned, a software update can easily take care of any of these issue.Camera Image:The image is very clear and looks great whether viewing it on my IPHONE, IPAD or laptop. I had it set to full frame rate and can achieve that most times. The night vision works very well with great range on the IRs and no reflections back into the camera. I found the IRs can be just a little bright when the place is covered in snow but it's hardly noticeable.Overview:I would recommend this camera to anyone who would like to monitor outside a home or business. It could be also used in larger inside areas as well such as a garage. With very little network or computer knowledge most people should be able to set one of these cameras up. I would suggest using a static IP address where possible and you must forward ports on your router to make this viewable outside of your home or business.  Unless anything changes I will give this a 5 star rating.

Reviews.Title: Not Impressed!!
Reviews.Author: J. Kyle Harris "JK"
Reviews.Content: Received the camera and got it on my network and working over the Internet with little difficulty.  I was just ready to get it mounted when I thought I better look at the video one more time.  The video started jumping and going all different colors and only showing on half the screen.  Thank goodness I didn't mount it on the side of the barn and find the defect!!  So, I returned it and will look for a better quality camera.

Reviews.Title: Great product, bad customer support team....
Reviews.Author: Jeff A Kriezel
Reviews.Content: If you have the courage to set this up yourself then you will be very happy. If you are one that would need help through customer support, you will probably never get them to answer. The camera itself was perfect, but I had never set one up before and I wanted to view it from my android phone. with a little research about ddns servers, I was surprised at how easy it was.  My best advice is to make sure you plug it directly into the router via cat5 to access the menus at first. Once setting up the WiFi is complete you can unplug it and move it to any location with a power source. Once I figured it out, I was so happy with the quality of the video and smoothness of the pan & tilt. I bought one more and set it up in minutes.  BTW this camera does not support zoom, or Microphone.....The infrared night vision is awesome and on the droid phones I recommend using TinyCam monitor pro for about $3.99 also works with the Kindle Fire and is so clear. you won't be disappointed with the picture quality either.  Love it!!

Reviews.Title: Poor image quality, out of focus
Reviews.Author: J. Canfield "John - old geek"
Reviews.Content: Update 9/27/2012:Cam returned and received by Amazon :-) Thank you Amazon - you rock!!  Just ordered the new Panasonic WV-SW175 pan-tilt outdoor cam.  This puppy will do 720P (1280x960) and is rated IP55 outdoor.  I'll be doing a review on this cam in a couple of weeks.  Street price is in the $500-600 range.  I'm very comfortable with Panasonic cams - I have five of them.------------------------------------I *really* wanted to like this camera due to the attractive price and since I needed to replace a very old Toshiba PT outdoor IP cam that isn't working well, but after three weeks of evaluation, this cam is going back to Amazon :-(First off, this cam does not have audio capabilities in spite of the user interface with those available options which leads me to believe that not a penny (yen) more was spent on on software/firmware development than absolutely necessary to get this camera to market.  While talking about the user interface, the cam movement control buttons provide no visual feedback (as in a mouseover action) that the buttons are active and your mouse click actually was received by the cam.The user feature set needs to *much* more robust.  For one example there is no choice about an uploaded file name (the ability to overwrite an uploaded file.)  My Toshiba and Panasonic cams have options that let you upload a file with the same file name for overwrite.  I have a web page which gets a new image uploaded every one to two minutes and the image *must* have the same file name in order for it to be viewed.  Only having timestamping for a file name doesn't work in all situations.I found color balance to be pretty good in an indoor daylight situation, IR night vision worked fairly well, and auto exposure indoors was surprisingly good (but a little slow to respond to changing light conditions.)Colors were somewhat washed out outdoors in bright light but the primary issue is poor image quality, either outdoors or indoors.  Areas of the picture are noticeably out of focus, I'll upload a sample picture and you can decide for yourself.Another problem was the one-shot or save picture feature (take a still picture) worked one time.  Every time I tried to capture a new still image, I always got the first one I snapped.Emails to support were not promptly answered.Lastly, when will the makers of these cheap outdoor cams realize the dongle MUST GO!  I want a cam with PoE capability and no exposed dongles!Final thoughts:I have come to the conclusion that there is NO WAY you are going to buy a quality outdoor PT or PTZ cam for under $500.  If you find one, let me know.  In the meantime, I'm looking closely at the ACTi line of outdoor cams, particularly the KCM-7211 - it's an outdoor HiDef PTZ (optical zoom with auto focus) with PoE - street price seems to be around 700 bucks.EDIT:  Oops.. The KCM-7211 is NOT PTZ - the lens is fixed :-(

Reviews.Title: Agasio A622W
Reviews.Author: GEDS
Reviews.Content: The images from the camera are great, even in darkness due to the IR filter.  Set-up is not too bad if you have setup other cameras before.  The Active X required for the camera is unsigned, so you need to disable some of your desktop security to install it.  Documentation could be improved!  I am using the wireless feature to connect to this camera.I have had this camera now for about a month.  What I have found is that the camera randomly moves to its home position.  This could happen in a few hours or a few days, but it will happen.  I have not found a way to define a new home position on this camera, as can be done with many models of Panasonic PTZ cameras.  The other issue this camera has is that it will stop sending video.  This has happened twice now.  When this happens, you need to log into the camera to restart it or you must unplug it.  I have mine hooked up to a timer now.I use IP Cam Viewer on my smartphone to manage my cameras.  What I have found is that you can control most of the PTZ functions of this camera if you define it as a Foscam FI8904W.I haven't been able to find another wireless PTZ camera with IR in this price range.  For now I will live with a timer and hope that a firmware upgrade will address the issues I have.

Reviews.Title: Poor quality and unreliable
Reviews.Author: Scimanic
Reviews.Content: Although the I like the physical design of this camera (1 star for that), the firmware/software has a lot of issues. After receiving this camera, I tested it for a couple of weeks before installing. after a few days it locked up (could not access using using the "IP Camera Tool" supplied with the camera or via the web browser. It seemed to get worse as time went on (locking up daily). In addition, the image would distort (image and color distortion) after changing resolutions. This distortion also showed in video recordings. I suspect there is also a manufacturing quality issue as I observed a piece of metal (possibly a component lead clipping) resting inside the dome. I took a chance with this camera and lost. I had to pay shipping back to FOSCAM. very disappointed.

Reviews.Title: You get what you pay for - would not recommend
Reviews.Author: RK "roka"
Reviews.Content: // To view this video download Flash Player (version 9.0.115 or higher)'); } } catch(err) { fp_resizePlayerSpace('cv_mo3S7A1BUCYFRDE', 0, 0); } return false; } function _cv_mo3S7A1BUCYFRDEloadSwf(movieID, playerVersion) { var swfLocation = "http://g-ecx.images-amazon.com/images/G/01/am3/20120510035744301/AMPlayer._V148501545_.swf"; var swfWidth = "320"; var swfHeight = "100%"; var flashVersion = "9.0.115"; var bgColor = "#FFFFFF"; var swfParams = {}; var flashParams = {}; var embedAttributes = {}; swfParams.amazonPort = "80"; swfParams.allowFullScreen = "true"; } } } Length:: 0:28 MinsI have very similar experience with this camera like other reviewers here.My scenario: Mounted on the front of the house (2nd level) to overview front yard, street and driveway.Main issues:- poor night vision (circular haze)- image quality (it is only a 640x480)- would sometimes just fail and needs to be powered off and on to reactivate- pan/tilt presets are off at times (your preset would not set the camera in the position you thought it would)Seeing how fast the IP camera world is moving today, I would not buy this camera again. There are better cameras available. 2-3 MP PTZs are still expensive though. But if you can live without PTZ, then look for IPC/Dahua or QSee cameras.Note on the provided video: This camera is a little older than one year at this point. It's subject to all weather (Austin, TX) besides snows and anything below 20F.

Reviews.Title: Buyer beware
Reviews.Author: W. P. Hill
Reviews.Content: I recently two of these cameras for use in my home on a Mac OS system with AirPort Extreme. I should have believed the ratings of other buyers of these cameras. There are some positive aspects in fairness which I will point out. The camera is a well made sturdy instrument. Set up on my Mac OS AirPort Extreme router was relatively easy as I am pretty capable in the port forwarding process. Both cameras were wall mounted outside my home. Let me state that if you only want to use these cameras for daytime viewing, the picture is excellent and the camera works very well in it's pan and tilt ability. If you expect to see anything outside at night, forget about this camera. The fact that engineers would allow a product of such poor or non existing night ability to be offered for sale is a poor reflection on the company. All night viewing except under high wattage spotlights is distorted by a halo effect which renders this product useless.

Reviews.Title: Circular Haze
Reviews.Author: Edwin P. Thomas "edth"
Reviews.Content: The daytime pictures are fine but at night it's difficult to see anything at all. The ir leds are reflecting off the dome into the camera. If this was fixed I would rate the camera 5 stars.

Reviews.Title: good front end product with bad supporting features.
Reviews.Author: shadowplyr
Reviews.Content: this is a great product on the front end, the camera is well built and looks really high end one thing that i dont like is the power cord for it, it breaks off halfway down into some..... weird halfway clip off cord....i really dont even understand how to explain it.... set up was relatively simple, plug it in, insert CD and boom you are set (unless you have to manually change the camera's IP address because the pre set one doesnt work with your router but if you are a little tech savvy its not an issue)now that i had my camera on....i wanted to check it out!!! on chrome just enter the IP address...and.... logged in, this is super sweet guys! good quality picture, smooth transition with refresh rate... man this is nice... but whats this?!?! i can log in with I.E and i get more features?!?!!? well that seems silly but let me try it... ***this is where the bad supporting features start....first off to utilize I.E. you have to disable pretty much every security feature imaginable because the certificate that the product uses cant be verified (for some reason) even with doing this, literally removing ALL security features i couldn't get it to work on I.E. so the audio, capture picture, and voice features i guess i will just never get to use (not a huge deal)SECONDLY there is no app for your smart phone, does it work on your smart phone? yes... barely.... you have to figure out what your actual home IP address is and enable port forwarding and then you have to type your IP address into your web browser on your phone... not a huge deal right? should be ok!!! but no, this is the biggest downfall of this product, the load time is crazy long, the picture is a captured picture refreshed every 15 seconds (from what i can tell) i tried to learn how to clean it up but i couldn't figure out a way to do it.TL;DR?pros;good designsleek lookgood pricegood quality picturecons;bad softwareno app for smart phonesmakes you disable security features on your computer to utilize all featuresoverall.... for what i will use it for (letting the GF watch the dogs play outside while she is at work) it will be perfect and fine with no issues (although a zoom would be nice) but if you want something that is VERY easy to use and requires no tech savvy on your part... this probably isnt for you... and if you need to use a security camera on your phone DO NOT GET THIS PRODUCT... maybe they will come out with a app for it and then we can revisit this fact.... i have not used it except for set up since it is a christmas present so i will let you know more after christmas!

Reviews.Title: Not the best choice for an outdoor Foscam clone
Reviews.Author: Curtis Walker
Reviews.Content: I purchased one of these for a home in Las Vegas. It is placed underneath a patio awning to keep all direct sun and moisture off it. The included power supply is similar to that of the Foscam cameras, but mine emitted a noticeable buzzing. The video from the camera even fritzed out and glitched while I watched it, something I'd not seen any of my wireless cameras do before. Fortunately, I had a few spare 12v transformers lying around, so I switched the camera over to a more robust model. That stopped the fritzing out, but the IR lens filter will no longer cycle. It is permanently stuck in "day" mode, so that I can't see anything at night.After stating the above to the seller, I was told they would be happy to resolve my issue by issuing a replacement power supply. The camera is junk. Buy a camera without built in IR +a weatherproof IR LED array, and you will have a more useful setup, IMO. If purple grass really annoys you, get a camera with an IR cut filter, but be aware that it might get stuck either open or closed, if you are unlucky as I am, with your purchase.The lack of warranty support is troubling, but not unexpected.

Reviews.Title: Customer reviews true...
Reviews.Author: Lawrence J. Kindrick
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera on a whim. I didn't really need it but it was on sale and I thought I'd take the chance.  I've got a few other fixed web cams around my house/property and I liked the Pan/Tilt. I read several reviews and they mainly said the same things which came true on mine. I set it up inside to check it out and had it running for over a week. I found that it dropped off the network several times which required a power reset to get it talking again. When it did stay on the network for 24 hours it would reset twice a day and go to it's home position. I'm using Blue Iris and all my other cameras stayed up with no problem when this cameras dropped off. Not so good for surveillance when it doesn't look at what you want to see. Since I didn't really need it I'll consider the experiment failed and just return it. Since I never had it mounted outside I can't speak to other performance issues.

Reviews.Title: BETTER THAN EXPECTATION
Reviews.Author: Henry L. DuPlantier
Reviews.Content: I received a well packed and manufactured product.  After initial startup I could not get the unit to operate so I contacted TechSupport who had me up and running within 5 minutes of me dialing the tech support number.  I was able to configure the unit via the RJ45 port.  I will say, having some light networking knowledge will help you configure the unit a little faster.  After confirming the unit worked well using the RJ45 I went onto configure the wireless portion which worked great until I installed the unit at the permanent location.  I could no longer control the unit or see it on my network.  Instead of calling tech support I read other reviews to see if other's who purchased may have had similar problems.  The answer is yes.  Here is how I fixed my problem.  First I had to understand that the camera operates in wireless-G frequency, my router is an N.  Simple fix, I put the router in mixed G and N mode.  I then had to figure which channel of the wireless-G worked best for my camera.  After all of that it would work for a few hours and then stop again.  Finally, I figured I would put my software in garage pulse signal mode.  That configuration seems to have fixed the problem.  After installation, weather proofing the RJ45 connection and reset button was needed since the wires are not long enough to be routed in doors.  I am extremely pleased with the video, control, but mostly the sturdy manufacturing of the product.I only give this a 3 star because there is not much information in the manual on how to reset the unit or that it operates in wireless G mode.  Had that been in the manual my set up time may have gone from 5 hours to 1.  Overall, this is a steal of a quality product for the price being offered.  I would recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: Decent.  IR leads to washed out haze
Reviews.Author: AndrewCCM "Andrew - Crystal Clear Media"
Reviews.Content: I have several (6) IP cams as part of my security setup.  I was excited to get this one.  However, if you plan to rely on it's IR ability, you may be disappointed.  At night, the surrounding area looks like a wash of haze (like inside a cloud).  I can barely make out what's in the picture unless the subject is directly in front of the camera and only a couple of feet away.  I ended up just disabling the IR functionality.  My other cameras do not suffer this problem and blast out IR clean and clear.  I am not certain what is causing this on this particular model, but it's not usable in my opinion.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera / Poorly Thought Out Design
Reviews.Author: A. Martine
Reviews.Content: I'm really torn on this review of the Agasio A622W camera because as a pure-play camera it provides really great quality recordings for the price range.  The night time recording is good (a little reflection but mostly okay) and the daytime footage is great.BUT, for some reason the engineers decided to only make 50% of the product ready to be an outdoor camera.  The casing is very robust and it looks like it'll last some time, but they didn't design the power cord to be outside and in the elements, nor did they make this version Power Over Ethernet.  The power cord - simple brick with a thin wire isn't ready to be outside all the time, there's no direct 110V connection and I need a separate injector to push power to it via ethernet.It just leaves me feeling like they hit a long fly ball to deep center field that was subsequently caught on the warning track.  I'd recommend this camera to someone who wants it in a sheltered location or can get creative with injectors, but for folks who need it to be really outdoors, I'd recommend another version.

Reviews.Title: Wireless Is Unreiiable  - Nightvision Is Worthless - No Firmware Updates Since Release - Poor Support
Reviews.Author: grumpyolman
Reviews.Content: Other than that, it looks  nice but you could have bought a dummy cam for $20.  Even with a dedicated wireless access point ten ft. away with no obstructions, it constantly drops out leaving you with no signal for several minutes at a time - usually when you need it most.  No firmware updates is puzzling - page under construction for 2-1/2 years.  They obviously didn't get it right the first time. As stated in other reviews, the LEDs should be outside the dome, not inside where the reflection wipes out the image.Hard wired indoors works fine but there are much better choices for that application.

Reviews.Title: It works, but it's not a winner.
Reviews.Author: D. Briddle
Reviews.Content: I am a tech very familiar with IP cameras.  The only reason I gave this two starts (instead of one), is that I did get it to work.The user interface is very difficult.  I had much difficulty getting the software installed in IE.  I followed all the guides on what to do, even tried it in IE on both Win7 and Win 8.  I did get it working a few times but then IE stopped working and would give an error and close.I was able to access the software functions properly in Firefox using the IETab addon.During the daytime, the picture is fabulous.  With IR, it's just ok.When searching for support, I found the company's forum to be full of spam messages and functionally useless.  Even the company's website is sprinkled with obvious signs that they have hurried through a WordPress setup.I'll let you know how this works out.

Reviews.Title: A622W better than expected
Reviews.Author: Eric
Reviews.Content: I was pleasantly surprised at this unit. I have purchased and used much more expensive units for commercial installation. This one was for home to monitor the pool area. I had low expectations for a $189 PTZ IP device with IR. Setup was quick and mounted under the eves, connected via CAT5e. I have not tested or tried the wireless. I am able to view via web and iphone. Works great day and night. The limitations are:- The device will not go non stop 360 (there is a stop and you have to go the other direction- The resolution is low- No PoEI recommend this device as a low end device with many features.

Reviews.Title: IT expert
Reviews.Author: Salvador Salgado
Reviews.Content: Electric motor that allows for tilt and pan stopped working 5 months after purchase, Product only has 90 Day warranty, will not buy from this manufacturer or seller again

Reviews.Title: GOOD PRODUCT
Reviews.Author: Jaroslaw R.
Reviews.Content: GOOD QUALITY, NOT TOO COMPLICATED SET UP.  GOOD APPS WORKING ON ANDROID. STRONG ALUMINIUM BODY. ONLY WEIRD ALL  CLEAR DOME IS MOVING. RECOMMEND  IT!

Reviews.Title: Terrible, just plain terrible.
Reviews.Author: Computer Nerd
Reviews.Content: Wow.  I'm literally stunned at the consumers here who offer a 4-Star rating for this camera.  It's 1-Star, at best.  First off, the picture clarity is abysmal.  I have this camera as part of a 6 camera group that I have monitoring my property.  The Agasio A622W is installed in front of my home so that I can log in and check on my property while I'm at work or away for any extended period of time.  The picture quality is pretty bad and the quality is even worse at night.  The glare from the street lights distorts the images and the only utilities offered to tweak this are the Bright and Contrast options in the web interface.  Speaking of web interface, this has to be the clunkiest interface that I've ever used.  First of all, it doesn't (the web interface) work well unless you weaken all of your security in Internet Explorer.  When you do this, Internet Explorer even warns you that your computer is at risk.  Great.  Firefox and Chrome work also, but you will NOT get all of the options that you would ordinarily get using Active X in Internet Explorer.  It gets better.  When this camera reboots, it's not smart enough to go the last position where it was, it goes back to the factory default position.  Terrible, just terrible.  Do Not believe the advertisement for this camera that says it has "True Color" Images, that is a 100% lie. When I look out from this camera my grass is gray, not green. I even called Agasio (Foscam) and had them remotely log into my computer and try to adjust the settings, no luck.  Also, the DDNS for this camera is not free, so you will have to pay for a DDNS host if your home environment does not have a static IP address.  The only thing good about this camera is that it's  nice looking, but when it comes to performance, save your money.  Folks, take it from a guy who has 6 cameras, you will NOT be happy with the A622W.  When a product is goo, I'm more than happy to praise it.  But when something is bad, it deserves equal air time.

Reviews.Title: Fantastic
Reviews.Author: Clifton Cabaness "Doug"
Reviews.Content: Kate at Foscam was great!!! She took control remotely and set up my camera very quickly we are extremely happy with this camera and look forward to continued shopping with Agasio!!

Reviews.Title: Great Service by Foscam rep on the Agasio A622W Outdoor Wireless Pan/Tilt IP Camera
Reviews.Author: Patrick S.
Reviews.Content: Agasio A622W Outdoor Wireless Pan/Tilt IP Camera with IR-Cut Off Filter for TRUE COLOR Images (Not Washed Out), Auto-Iris (Auto-Brightness Adjustment), IP66 Waterproof Enclosure, 50ft Nightvision, 4mm lens (72° Viewing Angle), Synology & Blue Iris Compatible, Pan 360° Tilt 90°, White]]mpatible, Pan 360° Tilt 90°, White (Electronics)The camera was easy to setup for viewing but because of the instructions on getting the alerts sent to my email, I had to call Foscam.  I got connected with Allen Smith and then Ralph in no time he had we setup with emails and config for Live Cam pro.  Also Ralph got me setup for remote operation...what a great team!!  It was a pleasure dealing with Ralph...thanks!!

Reviews.Title: it doesnt work in the darkness
Reviews.Author: alejandro arguelles
Reviews.Content: The plastic of the lens forms a halo that obscures well in the dark image. Please not buy this cam! !,

Reviews.Title: A total loss of $$ absolutely JUNK
Reviews.Author: Carlos A. Barberis
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera almost six months ago to keep an eye over the web on my pool area in my house in Florida. It has been nothing but problems the camera goes into strange modes and resets even when no power failures have ocurred. I have four other wifi cameras in this house and not one has failed or ever given me as many problems as this cam has.  Most of the time I have to send out a neighbor to recycle the power so I can get the camera back on line. It is rare to get five continuos days of normal operation. Finally this camera seems to have gone south and no longer works.  I will be replacing it with another cam, definetely not this model or manufacturer.I strongly advise anyone contemplating the purchase of one of these to look elsewhere unless you want to lose your money. My review shows one star, but it should be negative five stars

Reviews.Title: Great at daytime
Reviews.Author: Machinematrix
Reviews.Content: Daytime is great, but getting dome glare from IR's at night.  So much that you are forced to turn off IR's at night for clear picture.  Still working on solutions for this issue.  Also, firmware does not return cam to last position after a power blink.  I don't like to have to check often that it is pointing where my home position needs to be.  Otherwise bot to bad a unit...

Reviews.Title: Not happy with Wi-Fi
Reviews.Author: Third Rock "Third Rock"
Reviews.Content: I ordered four of these but returned one because the Wi-Fi would not work out of the box.  I've had the remaining three cameras in operation for about four months.  I'm using a LinkSys 802.11g wireless access point that has been in place for over a year and have had no problems with it.  Two of the cameras are 50 feet from the WAP and one is 30 feet from the WAP.  I have had problems with the signals being lost on all three cameras daily.  I changed my WAP antenna to one that is for longer range and this did not help any.  I've been connecting a laptop to the same WAP just as a reference and have had no problems with signal loss.  I even moved the WAP to about 20 feet from one of the cameras and was still losing signal.I finally ran Cat5e cable to two of the cameras and all is working great now on those cameras.  The third camera that is at 30 feet is still losing Wi-Fi signal daily.  I'll be running Cat5e cable to that camera soon.I purchased this camera for the Wi-Fi capability so I would not have to route any cables.As for the images I have no complaints.  The colors are good.I'll not be buying any more of them.

Reviews.Title: Technical Support, Great  -  Feature performance, Poor
Reviews.Author: JOSEPH
Reviews.Content: Outstanding technical support with regard to helping me interface the IP camera to the internet. They helped me down load Google Crome so that the camera worked. Camera works but have not had the time to check out all of the options.Follow-upAfter learning that that Internet Explorer was not supported I was advised to down load Google Chrome. Once Google chrome was openrd the camera image appeared on my PC. The only problem was that all of the options that were available for IE were not availble for Google Chrome. This made the camera overpriced for the money and as a result is being returned to Amazon. I don't mind the two hours of time spend getting an education but I do mind when the product is not capable of acheiving most of its specified paramaters. Once again the technical supprt personal who help me correct the problem was outstanding and knew exactly what the problem was. The real problem is the manufacturer because they clearly didn't state the limits of the software.

Reviews.Title: Good
Reviews.Author: nitevision eyes
Reviews.Content: The product is good apart from that I am yet to figure out how to record images. It has great quality pictures especially during day time and also has a great pan and tilt angle. gave it a 3 coz I have tried everything but it still aint recording. I have called the customer service countless times but they always put me on hold so I am almost giving up.

Reviews.Title: Borerline Acceptable... sort of....  If I am in a good mood.
Reviews.Author: The real Amazon fan
Reviews.Content: I use this over my driveway outside and for the most part it 'works.'  I can monitor my vehicles parked outdoors, or watch my kids get on/off their school bus.The images are clean if it's not too bright outside.  The camera flickers during a sunny day.  It appears it cannot auto compensate brighteness and it flickers between dark and light screen modes.  There is on firmware as of 9/20/2012 that fixes this, atleast Agasio doesn't seem to.Night vision image is sort of acceptable.  Not pro-quality sharp images by any means, but it's enough that I can tell if it's a dog or a human walking along the edge of the driveway.  LOL  Yah I know, sounds like a joke but it's not.The Agasio software is rather terrible.  It's a pc-based software and it has no capability to program tilt/pan settings.  I can still see the image and pan/tilt via my mac but again, no programming.I am using my android app called IP CamViwer Pro.  Combined with this app, it's pretty good.Will see how this thing works in the winter with snow...

Reviews.Title: A622W is a nice product
Reviews.Author: Casual Shopper
Reviews.Content: The A622W is a nice product. Feels very solid. The API documentation was very helpful. The web interface software needs a bit of work however. I've had only a fair amount of success using the controls to move the camera lens. The automatic sweeps however work just fine. Luckily, I plan to generally leave the camera pointed in one direction. I plan to have this outside in the winter, so I'll find out what happens when the temperature goes below the operational range.

Reviews.Title: Returned Item to Amazon
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: The camera worked fine when tested at short distance, but I returned it because of "where I needed to install" it.  It was too far from my Router for a Wi-Fi signal, maybe 30-40 feet from Router to outside Utility Pole.  Only complainr I have it I wish it were possible to use Wi-Fi at a longer distance.

Reviews.Title: Great image while it lasted.
Reviews.Author: R. Smith
Reviews.Content: This camera gave us a great view in daylight, dark & with porch lights on. It was easy to set up & operate.Our Mac/Safari would run most of it's controls but not all. Some may know how to get complete Mac control but we were happy with the basics especially since the image was so clear.We left town for a couple months & the camera went down. When we returned & weren't able to boot it back up, we spent 5 hrs. with Agasio's nice tech team. They finally agreed that the camera was permanently down, probably due to a defective power cord & had us contact Amazon for return instructions. We're currently waiting for those instructions but wouldn't grumble since they'll make it good. When Agasio asked if we wanted another A622W or something different, we agreed to another A622W. They don't make another camera with all of it's abilities & any company can have an occasional malfunctioning unit .We have other Foscams (  indoor & outdoor) that have worked well since last winter/spring.

Reviews.Title: It's ok for daytime viewing
Reviews.Author: Sparky
Reviews.Content: This camera is fine for daytime viewing but forget trying to use the night IR lighting.  When the night IR lights are on, the image gets washed out from the glare reflecting back off the glass.  I had to disable the IR's and buy an external IR floodlight panel to use instead of the built in IR lights.  Other than the poor design of the night time lighting, the camera works ok.  Two stars because I need night time viewing more than daytime and this camera failed at that requirement.

Reviews.Title: Love Love Love this IP cam
Reviews.Author: Guitars United
Reviews.Content: The Agasio is SWEEEEEET. I have it mounted up high and it is perfect for that application. The wireless is flawless and works good in about 50ft from the router. I did extend my WiFi with a additional router and made the WiFi stronger. The pan feature is excellent and smooth. The night vision is not that good unless you have a light near it. Sometimes this camera is in full sunlight and the picture is still flawless.

Reviews.Title: Disappointed
Reviews.Author: The Lieutenant
Reviews.Content: I've had my camera for slightly over a week. The initial wireless setup was problematic as the documentation is poor. Once I got past this, everything else about the camera was commendable, especially the video quality, even at night. I was just getting ready to set it up outdoors this weekend....only to find the camera dead; it won't turn on. I can't get hold of support (same problem when I had an issue with connectivity). I have no confidence in this product or the company. It's a shame given the quality of the video is not bad at all.UPDATE:It's been almost a year. I would not recommend this camera in all fairness. I've had to reset it multiple times as it disconnects from my wireless network all the time.And no, problem is not the wireless setup as the setup has been done as per their recommendation, my access point's firmware is updated, the signal is great, no interference...The night vision is great, if the camera is setup indoors, but when setup outdoors (which is what I bought the camera for), the night vision is worthless. I have set it up on my driveway, and I can barely see my cars and the camera is literally 10feet above the cars.For the amount of money I paid for this, camera, this was a loss.

Reviews.Title: Wireless Camera
Reviews.Author: HJMG
Reviews.Content: The camera is a good equipment and will most likely do the job I bought it for. However, making the software run with active x control is a major hassle under Windows 7. Without changing the security settings the sofware will NOT install. It took me about 2 hours to figure out and test the settings to make it work.Both the ethernet connection and the wireless work well and allow a good control of the camera movements up to 100 feet from the router. It is also some hassle to configure the router for the camera. Since I use a reliable business router (MOTOROLA) it takes some time to make it work with the camera. The settings have to be made manually with the ethernet cable connected to the camera. Once it is set up and the router recognizes the camera, the wireless will also work.In cases of placing the camera away from a power source (house), it is recommendable to install a 2 pair power cable for 12 volts, not to exceed 150 feet. This power cable must be equipped with a jack on one end to plug into the power adapter and a plug to go into the camera. The jack and plug are available on E-Bay but ususally come in bundles of 10, when you need only one of each. Jack and plug should come with the camera.Using a small solar panel for the power supply and a night battery is a feasible option to install the camera as a stand alone equipment and make it accesible under an ftp site.Also missing is a camera mount to a flat surface or a pole. I made a flat mount of polycarbonate myself, works well and perfectly fits to a standard DOT street sign pole of 10 feet height.Once the camera is off the floor, there is no way to reach the reset button unless climbing up a ladder. This is a feature that requires improvement such as a remote reset command as used in communication equipment.Conclusion:1. Good camera with high value for the dollar2. The connections need some attention (to the computer and the router)3. The software installation instructions need improvement4. The power jack and plug should be added to the supply5. The operation / installation manual is outdated and does not truly reflect the actual camera but somehow still serves the purpose.Once you have one camera set-up which will not exceed a total cost of $400.00 you can create your own alarm and surveillance system with up to 8 cameras for yourself. Such can also be combined with emergency calling (911) with a pre-recorded message. In any case your company and / or house can be supervised by yourself remotely. No contract or specialized company needed. With a cheap webbook and an external hard drive recording is simple and reliable.

Reviews.Title: Nice IP Camera
Reviews.Author: Chris
Reviews.Content: This is my first security camera and I feel I got pretty lucky in choosing this one.  I've been running it for 2 weeks and although its had some issues, I've been happy with it.First, I learned that this camera falls into a category of cameras that is often called "Foscam Clones" or "Chinese IP Cameras".  It turns out this is a good thing because it means the camera will work with almost any desktop or smartphone app that works with Foscam cameras.  If your interested in programming your own apps, you can search for "IPCAM CGI SDK" for docs on remote interaction with the camera or "Open IP Cam" for people that work on free replacement firmware.All the cameras in this class are not the simplest things to set up.  You need to be pretty comfortable with setting up IP devices.  If your not comfortable with that, you might look for a device that claims ease of use as its main feature.Agasio's web page has a help forum and documentation online if you run in to issues.  If they are unable to resolve your issues there, I suggest then moving to Foscam's help forums since they hardware is somehow related.  In fact, it was on their web site I found the solution to the main issue I have with this camera.The video feed will sometimes "strobe" from dark to light and this causes false motion detection.  Foscam forums mentioned this is somehow related to data overload.  If your wifi signal is weak and your pushing highest video resolution and frame rate, it can cause this as the data backs up.  Either use an Ethernet cable or lower resolution to resolve this issue.  If it ever gets into this mode, you will be forced to manually reset it (using web interface) to correct it.If you look at cameras in this price range and feature set, they are mostly clones of each other (probably have exact same internal parts) with main difference being either supporting zoom or night vision; but not both.  I prefer the night vision of this camera.  X10 recently announced a $100 more camera that supports both but the verdict is still out on them and their customer service is iffy.The other thing that is different among cameras in this class is the external housing and its quality.  Most look cheap and plasticy. This camera is all metal with nice lines and glass.  The product picture looks like it would be bright white but I was happy to find its an off white which fits in better in most outside colors.I recommend this camera overall but you will have to deal with manually monitoring it and rebooting it.  It will be of most use if you use it in combination with a PC based app such as ZoneMinder or Blue Iris that will give you some additional tools to overcome any design issues.

Reviews.Title: Performs as expected
Reviews.Author: Joseph Cobb "Motorhead"
Reviews.Content: I installed this product today replacing a Loftek Sentinel D1. The camera itself is the same resolution and nearly identical all around other than the dome on the Sentinel is fixed and the Agasio dome moves with camera.  The Agasio also of course has the night vision which is main reason I bought it. The sentinel is good in day time but is pathetic at night even with a light on outside. Night performance is adequate for .3 megapixel and for the cost it is a viable IP camera. I hard wire my cameras so no review on the wireless portion. I tested the record functions using webcamxp and it worked flawlessly as well. I sold my Sentinel to my neighbor as this person uses the instant on bright security lights which will adequately bathe the Sentinel for better functionality. Also the Apexis app worked perfect with this camera for my iPhone.

Reviews.Title: Great equipment for my needs!
Reviews.Author: colin
Reviews.Content: Setup was identical to setting up a Foscam camera. The user manual was not as great as Foscam's but if you know how to setup a Foscam then this is no problem. There is a lot of online documentation and forums on how to setup the Foscam camera. This camera basically is an outdoor waterproof pan tilt camera with IR nightvision. Its pretty unique and haven't found anything similar on the market. The other similar cameras would be the Foscam FI8602 but that is $400. There is also the Loftek. However, neither the Loftek nor the Foscam have IR night vision.

Reviews.Title: Agasio A622W failed out of box!
Reviews.Author: NW8R
Reviews.Content: Brand new Agasio A622W. Failed! Software needed key. Key was not sent in box. Customer support no help! After I managed to get the camera working and configured through web interface, picture quality was crap. Video colors were more like black and white. Picture keeps breaking up! Poor quality!  I read through the reviews, took a gamble, and lost!  Sent it back!Thank you Amazon for your fast return service and refund!Agasio A622W Outdoor Wireless Pan/Tilt IP Camera with IR-Cut Off Filter for TRUE COLOR Images (Not Washed Out), Auto-Iris (Auto-Brightness Adjustment), IP66 Waterproof Enclosure, 50ft Nightvision, 4mm lens (72° Viewing Angle), Synology & Blue Iris Compa...

Reviews.Title: Failed within 1 hour
Reviews.Author: Kyle
Reviews.Content: I was able to power on the unit and access it via my local PC.  Within the first hour, the unit lost connectivity.  The power light is lit but it cannot establish a connection with the router.  When I called tech support, they walked me through a troubleshooting procedure and determined that the unit had failed and needed to be returned.  I filed a return claim through Amazon and have not received a response.  I just called the Foscam contact number and did not receive an answer or even a recording.

Reviews.Title: Updated August 2012: Zero documentation
Reviews.Author: David L. Wilson
Reviews.Content: No idea if this even works as there was no documentation at all included in the box; visiting the manufacturer's site lets you view some user guides that appear to actually have been created by users. The Mac version advises users to use Google to find some unverified software and install it on your computer to complete the install. I have a better idea: I am, for the first time, sending an item to Amazon for a refund.On the positive side: It looks extremely rugged; it's heavy; nice external antenna. But I've installed a number of cameras at this point and the instructions for this one available on the Web site do not fill me with any confidence that the guys who built this did anything but kludge something together. It's a mess.Oh, and also I think the other review on this camera is bogus._________Update: Refund processed; I had to pay for shipping. In response to a couple of comments: No, didn't do any further research on the camera; as I said, the only instructions available to me advised that I modify my Mac's OS, which I'm not comfortable with.-----------------Next update August 2012: I just randomly checked on this and so am updating based on comments; I reiterate my position that nearly all the five star reviews of this product do not appear to be legitimate; it looks like nearly all of them call out a tech support specialist by name. In response to comments on this review: Yes, as I stated in my original review, I went to the company's Web site; their support documentation was abysmal, as I stated, but it could be better at this point. I did not attempt to contact tech support (as apparently nearly all the five star reviews did; I notice somebody stated they were happy to pay for this service). In response to the declaration in comments that I appear to be somewhat unsophisticated in setup; as I stated, I have a number of cameras operating on my property. In addition, I have a masters degree in information technology and I run a 22-member IT team. I reiterate my position that this camera does not appear to be well designed or properly manufactured. My favorite cameras at this point are from Panasonic, running with power injectors via ethernet cable (but I just ordered a couple of cheap DLink wireless cameras mostly for fun, which is why I went back and checked this camera).

Reviews.Title: Junk, STAY AWAY!
Reviews.Author: Joe Trigilio
Reviews.Content: Broken right out of the box.  When I attempted to remove the camera to further troubleshoot, the graphite neck snapped in half.  I got totally ripped off and would NEVER purchase another product from Agasio......do yourself a favor and read all of issues before you consider this brand.

Reviews.Title: What a waste!!!!!
Reviews.Author: fred
Reviews.Content: Should have paid attention to the reviews about this, ummm camera. One day it works well, the next day I am trying to get it to work. What a piece of junk.

Reviews.Title: not worth the agrivation
Reviews.Author: geo615
Reviews.Content: Purchased this camera because of it's description as a easy to set up ip camera.  It was anything but.  I followed the instructions to the letter and still spent 12 plus hours trying to make the camera work!.  It would boot up until I configured it for wireless operation and then it would not work at all.  The camera would move a little then stop but with no picture.  I powered it down for several hours and it would work with a lan cable but as soon as I tried to configure it for wireless it would fail.  The general construction was good and the enclosure was made of heavy aluminum. It was a good outdoor setup. Unfortunately I returned the camera because of the inability to configure for wireless operationAgasio A622W Outdoor Wireless Pan/Tilt IP Camera with IR-Cut Off Filter for TRUE COLOR Images (Not Washed Out), Auto-Iris (Auto-Brightness Adjustment), IP66 Waterproof Enclosure, 50ft Nightvision, 4mm lens (72° Viewing Angle), Synology & Blue Iris Compa...

Reviews.Title: Nightvision is useless, dark spot in center of picture
Reviews.Author: w.w
Reviews.Content: This thing is junk.  First of all, like other reviews mention, the "nightvision" doesnt work at all.  The IR just bounces around inside the dome and you cannot actually see anything.  Don't they test these products before they mass produce them?  This is an obvious design flaw that should have been caught.My camera has a dark spot in the center of the picture which I am assuming is from a damaged sensor or something.The Chinese software is junk as well.  It is so clunky and often time changes do not work when you save them.Save your money and get a better camera.

Reviews.Title: No rating.
Reviews.Author: vicah
Reviews.Content: I shouldn't rate this IP Camera because I wasn't able to install it, but "no rating" is not an option, so I just rated one star.  My computer (dell's with windows 7) cannot read the disc that came with the camera.  Online tools-support will take you to sales of indoor cameras.  I finally got into the support page, but it says that support is "coming soon."  I finally got to talk with somebody from Agasio with no result because he doesn't know either why the link doesn't get the support information, or why it says "coming soon."  So, I must have to return it and try another product.

Reviews.Title: This Item not as advertised
Reviews.Author: VenomTexas
Reviews.Content: i will not say what this product is, but i must say,, DISSAPOINTED.camera does not work as intended, disconnects from the surveillance system every few minutes (wifi), probably wired it may work.. camera is most of the time non responsive, my wifi network became an unstable when this is on it, disconnecting devices randomly, i had to set a DIFFERENT wifi device to get this camera to work on my network, and yet it still disconnects itself randomly.recording is good, video is good, night vision is good., camera moves and suddenly stops (not responding) for a while then is back to original prosition.. quite annoying, took me 2 hrs/install a different wifi router, update http gui, and many other hoops to make it work..and after is working you see above, really not worth it.web interface is good in options, if all of them worked as intended.support, is a NO NO... if it exists is very limited and unhelpful, webpage information is click here but click does nothing and no explanation is given.. fail.if you want a challenge and work to make by all means, go for it.. if you want a cam to work, well you know.

Reviews.Title: Excellent for the price !
Reviews.Author: Ian
Reviews.Content: Purchased 2 of these for a proof of concept project where high quality image was not critical.Both are mounted outside - one  completely exposed to sun with temps above 105f - can cause flicker in direct sun and wash out some views when sun very strong - but for my purpose not an issue. Second one is mounted in shade of a satellite dish temps still get to 100+ but no direct sunlight - works well with the shade helping avoid washing out landscape.Items to note - glass dome needs to be kept clean , desert dust affects it at night and rain drop stains will affect night vision - does NOT affect the daytime views.Set up - well patience helps , once you master the learning curve not too difficult. It appears to be a bit "browser" sensitive as regards the setup - I hate IE as a mac user , but ended up using it to configure - safari and firefox didn't seem to work as well on the setup. Once I had basic setup done both safari and firefox have worked.Issue - remotely added a user , unit went to reboot and hung - as I was 1000 miles away could not do a power off reboot - luckily in a couple of days thunderstorm cut the electrical power to the house so when it was restored unit rebooted and has been fine since.I have not used ALL the functions such as alarm or email - so cannot comment on them , for general area view and things like checking patio , gates to my house while away - these units have been good.I plan to order 2 more for testing in another location and then plan to move up to a higher resolution camera for the "view" cam looking out to sea where good resolution would be nice.In service time at present about 4 months in extreme conditions with regular use of the motors - I use wifi link but ethernet cable is also there and works well if your installation will allow it.Agasio - a 3 meg version of these would be awesome if you could hit the 400 or less mark !One item I don't like is the exposed reset button on the pigtail - can be too easy for 3rd party to reset in error let alone on purpose !

Reviews.Title: I'm Happy With It
Reviews.Author: Tom
Reviews.Content: I had already purchased an Agasio M1051 IP camera and was so pleased with it that I got this one too.  I can confirm some other reviewer's comments.  The camera box was labeled PTZ but it's not PTZ it's PT only.  It was not misrepresented on Amazon so I got what I expected.  There is a slight halo when it is on infra red (no big deal).  The documentation is not very helpful.  After having installed the M1051, I was expecting this one to be a breeze but it took me for a bit of a ride.  The installation was rather different.  This one does not appear on the router list of devices and I did have to open a port for it.  The M1051 did not need a port opened and was present in the router list.  I initially thought the unit was defective so called tech support.  They got back to me the next day.  By that time, I had got it working but still had some issues with some of the controls not being functional in the browser interface.  Sandra, at tech support, was very helpful in addressing my concerns and screen shared in my PC to get these issues resolved.  Now the interface is fully functional and I can even see my M1051 in the same window.  Not having any experience with other IP cameras, I cannot compare this to others but I am happy with both of these cameras.  They do all they claim.  I even set them up at times to snap photos on motion detect.  The camera emails me with a few samples while uploading a bunch more to a remote FTP site I have. Works very well.  In fact, you could put up a sign that reads "if you are reading this, it's too late.  Your picture has already been uploaded to a remote server. Have a nice day."  Be aware though, that this infrared wavelength is a sexual attractant to moths (who knew?).  So...at night you will get lots of cool moth pictures that look like the stuff on ghost hunters  :-)

Reviews.Title: Great Camera and Even better for this Price.
Reviews.Author: C. Butcher "TCB"
Reviews.Content: Well I bought one of these as a test to see if I could get a pan/tilt camera for this price. It is an awesome picture compared to other non P/T camera for this price. The colors in high light and med light all show up sharp and clean. At low light you can far enough away for me to focus on the object. I only issue with this camera is the P/T is slow. I understand that I can't like everything about the camera and that is the only complaint. Doesn't effect me to much since I already ordered two more and going to assign them to a group so they can work together.

Reviews.Title: A+ for customer service
Reviews.Author: Wayne King Jr
Reviews.Content: I had a problem connecting the camera to a wireless router.  I called the customer service number and within one minute I was on the phone with Eric Hill.  Eric resolved all my probelms and set up my remote access parameters with in five minutes.  Saved me hours.  Highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: Initially had trouble with Night Vision but was able to fix the problem
Reviews.Author: Sonny
